front.title: Defining the Role and Function of the IETF-IANA

abstract.t: This memo describes the role and function of the IETF-IANA.Many IETF protocols make use of commonly defined values that arepassed within protocol objects. To ensure consistent interpretationof these values between independent implementations, there is a needto ensure that the values and associated semantic intent areuniquely defined.The IETF uses a single registry to register these protocol valuesand their associated semantic intent. In this memo the registryfunction is referred to as the IETF Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IETF-IANA).This document provides a description of this function and proposesthat this description be adopted by the Internet Architecture Board(IAB).
